# NSPersistentCloudKitContainerOptions

**Class**

An object that customizes how a store description aligns with a CloudKit database.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSPersistentCloudKitContainerOptions
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSPersistentCloudKitContainerOptions] to customize the behavior of an [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSPersistentCloudKitContainer] or to create additional store descriptions that sync to other containers.

For more information about setting up multiple stores, see [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/setting-up-core-data-with-cloudkit].

## Creating Container Options

- **init(containerIdentifier:)**: Initializes container options using the given CloudKit container identifier.
- **containerIdentifier**: The identifier of the CloudKit container associated with a given store description.
- **databaseScope**: The database scope — public, private, or shared — to use for a specified store in a persistent CloudKit container.

## CloudKit mirroring

- **Mirroring a Core Data store with CloudKit**: Back user interfaces with a local replica of a CloudKit private database.
- **Synchronizing a local store to the cloud**: Share data between a user’s devices and other iCloud users.
- **NSPersistentCloudKitContainer**: A container that encapsulates the Core Data stack in your app, and mirrors select persistent stores to a CloudKit private database.
- **Sharing Core Data objects between iCloud users**: Use Core Data and CloudKit to synchronize data between devices of an iCloud user and share data between different iCloud users.
